task_summary: Detect the bread, approach with a pre-grasp, align, grasp it with a pinch, lift, and retreat safely.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 gripper must pick up a small bread roll from a tabletop covered by a green cloth. A white saucer sits nearby but the instruction focuses only on picking the bread. The robot first ensures the bread is visible, then opens the gripper, moves above the bread with a small vertical offset, computes a pinch grasp, aligns precisely, closes to pick, lifts slightly, and retreats to a safe distance. Timing is moderate; alignment requires tight tolerance to avoid pushing the bread away.
preconditions: Workspace clear except for bread and plate
Camera calibrated and bread within field of view
stepwise_plan: Move above bread to pre-grasp height
Compute grasp pose using pinch strategy
Approach and align with tight tolerance
success_criteria: Bread detected initially or via scan
Robot ends in safe, non-colliding posture
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure → scan using raster pattern
Misalignment or slip → sequence fails; re-run tree
Grasp failed → no ObjectInGripper; operator or higher-level retry can re-tick
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when bread is in gripper and the arm has lifted and retreated to a safe distance.

frame_5.now_evidence: Gripper at bread with plate as background; closing/engagement visible indicating grasp execution.
frame_5.predicts_next: Expect upward motion (lift) confirming successful grasp.

node_specs.description: Check if bread is currently visible.
Actively scan to detect bread if not immediately visible.
Prepare gripper aperture for pinch grasp.
Move to a pre-grasp pose directly above the bread.
Compute grasp pose and store in blackboard.
Descend/align precisely to the computed grasp.
Execute grasp using the computed pose.
Verify that the bread is held.
Back off to a safe distance after lift.

failure_modes: Bread not detected due to glare/occlusion
Bread pushed instead of grasped due to poor alignment
recovery_strategy: Re-open and re-approach with tight tolerance
If slip detected, re-tick from detection
Adjust pre-grasp height via MoveAbove offset
assumptions: Instruction requests only picking; frames show operation near a plate but not a placement. We prioritize picking as per instruction.
